Miyagi.title: Miyagi
Miyagi.byline: Miyagi Prefecture (宮城県 Miyagi-ken) is in the northeastern Tohoku region of the main Japanese island Honshu.

Miyajima.title: Miyajima
Miyajima.byline: Miyajima (宮島) is one of the crown jewels of Japan, and certainly one of its finest views.

Miyaki.title: Miyaki
Miyaki.byline: Miyaki (みやき町) is a town of 26,000 people (2017) in Saga Prefecture, Japan.

Miyako (Iwate).title: Miyako (Iwate)
Miyako (Iwate).byline: Miyako (宮古) is a small city of approximately 51,000 people (2020) on the eastern-most coast of Honshu, Japan's main island.

Miyako (Okinawa).title: Miyako (Okinawa)
Miyako (Okinawa).byline: Miyako (宮古島 Miyakojima) is the largest of the Miyako Islands.

Miyakonojo.title: Miyakonojo
Miyakonojo.byline: Miyakonojo (都城) is a city in Miyazaki prefecture.

Miyazaki.title: Miyazaki
Miyazaki.byline: Miyazaki (宮崎; ) is the prefectural capital of Miyazaki prefecture on the island of Kyushu, Japan.

Miyazaki (prefecture).title: Miyazaki (prefecture)
Miyazaki (prefecture).byline: Miyazaki Prefecture (宮崎県 Miyazaki-ken) is in the southeastern part of the Japanese island of Kyushu with a low population density.

Miyoshi (Hiroshima).title: Miyoshi (Hiroshima)
Miyoshi (Hiroshima).byline: Miyoshi is a city in Hiroshima Prefecture.

Miyoshi (Tokushima).title: Miyoshi (Tokushima)
Miyoshi (Tokushima).byline: Miyoshi City is in Tokushima Prefecture, Shikoku.
